results.title: Work it out (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A video, aimed at young women between the ages of 14-20 years, that examines career opportunities available. The subject areas covered include : Women at Work; Careers Counselling; Equal Opportunity; Personal Development; Industrial relations; Social Studies.

results.title: You've got to start somewhere
results.creator_credit: Maureen McCarthy, Chris Warner and Trout Films
results.brief_description: Focuses on a multicultural project at Ferntree Gully Primary School to show what teachers at schools with low migrant populations can do to put the philosophy of education in a multicultural society into practice.

results.title: Go for it!
results.creator_credit: Clayton Jacobson and Barwon Youth Employment Office for the Employment Access Program, Community Services Victoria
results.brief_description: A program aimed at young disadvantaged youth in the labour market, particularly those attending Youth Training Centres, Youth Welfare Services, living in hostels or in the care and custody of Community Services Victoria. Highlights young people succeeding in various jobs and through interviews discusses how they found employment, their expectations and experiences in the workforce.

results.title: Social security benefits: right or privilege?
results.creator_credit: Roger Ley, David Gardner and Centre for Study of Higher Education, University of Melbourne
results.brief_description: Outlines the work of a field officer with the Commonwealth Department of Social Security. Shows how the evidence found by the field officer can determine the continuation or cessation of a benefit. See also “Branda’s appeal”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roger Ley, David Gardner and Centre for Study of Higher Education, University of Melbourne

results.title: Immigration: the waves that shaped Australia
results.creator_credit: Paul Woolston-Smith and Dept Immigration and Ethnic Affairs
results.brief_description: This video outlines the migrations which have made us what we are, starting with the arrival of the ancestors of the Aborigines, approximately 40,000 years ago. The landing on 26th January, 1788, of the officer, marines and convicts of the First Fleet, started successive waves of mostly European migration whose cultures enriched our nation.

results.title: Wildlife of the River Valley
results.brief_description: A program that presents a unique view of the enormous variety of wildlife that lives in the Bellinger River Valley, situated halfway between Sydney and Brisbane on the east coast of Australia. This is a brightly paced, entertaining and informative documentary that can be enjoyed by audiences of all ages.
